video: 1920x800 AVC
audio1 (default): movie plus Rifftrax AAC 2.0
audio2: just movie AAC 5.1
audio3: just movie AAC 2.0
subs: English built in, off by default, not hard coded, software switchable
intro: 1s after the last riff comment
Riffers: Bill Corbett, Kevin Murphy, Mike Nelson 

Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone has 2 fantastic bonus audio tracks: Wizard People, Dear Reader. Both performances are very funny and different enough for their own listening. Below is a description edited from Wikipedia and a link to a list of Brad's alternative naming.
"Wizard People, Dear Reader (released in 2004) is an alternative soundtrack to Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone written by Brad Neely and is a narrative retelling of the lives of the characters of The Sorcerer's Stone. Two versions have been released, the first in summer 2004 and the second in early-mid-2005. The two versions are very similar: differences include fixing the weaker lines from the first version, and a more polished and thoroughly-rehearsed performance by Brad."
  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wizard_People,_Dear_Reader#Naming  

This is a remux with the Rifftrax commentary added as the default audio track. The Rifftrax audio track has been newly remastered to ensure the riff comments are just loud enough to be clear when the movie is loud and not too loud when the movie is quiet. Please leave any feedback regarding the Rifftrax audio remastering.

Big thanks to the posters of the 1080p/5.1 encodes of the movies, the subs, and the chapters.
